question: [File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Error Handling] [IO Error Recovery - Low] Are IO errors in read/write operations properly handled without leaving inconsistent state?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Consensus] [HashMap Ordering - Critical] Does HashMap iteration in calculate_binding_factors and nonces create non-deterministic behavior?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Consensus] [Serialization Determinism - High] Do write operations produce deterministic byte representations across all validators?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Consensus] [Point Encoding - High] Could different valid encodings of the same curve point cause validators to disagree on commitments?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Consensus] [Floating Point - N/A] Are there any floating-point operations that could cause consensus divergence (appears none exist)?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Integration] [Preprocess Storage - Critical] How are generated nonces stored between preprocess and signing phases, and could they be reused?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Integration] [Nonce Consumption - Critical] Is there a mechanism ensuring each nonce is consumed exactly once during signing?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Integration] [Session Binding - High] Are nonces bound to specific signing sessions to prevent cross-session reuse?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Integration] [Message Binding - High] Are nonces eventually bound to the message being signed through the transcript?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [DoS] [Commitment Count - High] Is there a maximum limit on the number of nonces/generators to prevent memory exhaustion in Commitments::new?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [DoS] [Participant Count - High] Is there a limit on the number of participants in BindingFactor to prevent HashMap exhaustion?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [DoS] [Malformed Read - High] Could an attacker provide malformed serialized data causing excessive memory allocation in read()?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [DoS] [Multiexp Cost - Medium] Could an attacker force expensive multiexp_vartime calculations with carefully chosen inputs?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Generators] [Identity Generator - High] If a generator is the identity element, do commitments become trivial enabling forgery?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Generators] [Low-Order Generators - High] Could low-order generators weaken the discrete log problem for commitments?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Generators] [Generator Substitution - High] Could an attacker substitute generators after commitment generation to break binding?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Generators] [Generator Duplication - Medium] What happens if the same generator appears multiple times in the list?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Generators] [Generator Ordering - Medium] Does the order of generators matter for security, or is it arbitrary?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Commitment Attacks] [Commitment Malleability - High] Could an attacker create different nonces with identical commitments?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Commitment Attacks] [Partial Commitment - High] Could an attacker reveal only D commitments but not E commitments?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Commitment Attacks] [Commitment Forgery - Critical] Could an attacker forge commitments without knowing the corresponding nonces?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Commitment Attacks] [Commitment Verification - High] Are received commitments verified to be valid curve points in the correct subgroup?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Binding Factor Attacks] [Factor Prediction - High] Could an attacker predict binding factors before revealing their commitments?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Binding Factor Attacks] [Factor Manipulation - Critical] Could a malicious participant manipulate binding factors by controlling the transcript?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Binding Factor Attacks] [Zero Binding Factor - High] What happens if a binding factor is zero, and does this break security?
